system.biography:
TitleFFF 803b Gargu-Kyani Princess
Birthday21 Nolus 709
AppearanceAge 10, height 3’4”, heavy frame (size 3), weight 75 lb, plain appearance, fair complexion, tawny brown hair, light gray eyes.
Medical/Psyche
Size0
ArmorPlain cloth skirt; leather bandoleer and sandals; plate ailettes. Round shield, mankar, and spear.
Other EquipmentNone
ValuablesSilver broach with ivory and jet inlay (180d), 2 silver earrings (15d each)
Notes

Biography

Tabeas was plucked from the egg chamber as soon as she hatched, taken by the princesses to be raised among the honor guard of the hive’s queen. Tabeas has embraced this role whole-heartedly, violently eschewing the role of queen to ensure that only worthy kings may sire strong warriors. Still young by gargun standards, she has proven herself many times over.

Although neither the largest nor the strongest of gargun, Tabeas has an almost palatable aura of will that throws off foes. She also shows a natural grace in every movement. An enemy will often take pause when confronted by Tabeas’ glamour, a critical moment that leads to their death when Tabeas strikes. These traits have served her well through the swarms and bloody civil wars that are a characteristic mark of life in a gragun hive.

Gargu-kyani are widely known by humans to be honorable (at least for gargun), in that they often show respect to those who account for themselves well in the midst of battle. Tabeas is a paragon of honor and holds an almost sacred duty to protect her queen and, by extension, the entire hive. Tabeas extends this duty to non-gargun as well. To her, all who acquit themselves well are due her respect.

Tabeas counts only males that can defeat her in combat as worthy to gain congress with the queen, and shows no hesitation in killing any she deems unfit. She engages the biggest and strongest males in battle and withdraws only when it is apparent that the male she confronts can hold well enough in combat. Otherwise, she invariably cuts down the challenger without hesitation. Her hive has also taken up this practice, even to the extent of throwing the bodies of unworthy males down the mountain side rather than taint themselves by feasting on such “inferior” flesh.

HOOKS

None Shall Pass! The PCs are attacking an orc nest when they are confronted by Tabeas. Only their deaths will dissuade her from her sense of duty!

Banished. The king, feeling threatened by Tabeas, banishes her from the hive. Loyal Tabeas reluctantly leaves. She wanders looking for an honorable cause when she sees the PCs in trouble in the wilderness. Would they be willing to accept the help of a gargun?

A Suitor. The PCs (most likely working with the local militia) are mopping up a gargun hive. Having just defeated a female warrior, the PCs are surprised when she throws down her spear and surrenders, declaring her opponent a worthy male who must take her and make her his queen.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Part 13” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/fff-gargu/), by Shawn Bond, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
